de.uulm.vs.android.crdt.controller

Class CRDTController

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uulm.vs.android.crdt.controller.CRDTController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BluetoothConnectionListener, ObjectExchangeListener, WiFiDirectConnectionListener, CRDTTransaction, CRDTChangeListener

    public class CRDTController
extends java.lang.Object
implements WiFiDirectConnectionListener, BluetoothConnectionListener, CRDTTransaction, CRDTChangeListener
    This class can handle multiple instances of CRDTs and communicate with an ObjectExchangeListener and an ExchangeConnectionHandler to merge them with instances on other devices.

    The changeListener implements the CRDTTransaction interface and can therefore begin, roll back and commit transactions. If a transaction is active, all incoming data will be stored in a queue and only then be merged with the local data after the active transaction has been finished.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • beginTransaction

        public void beginTransaction()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts a new transaction in the changeListener. The current state will be saved and can be rolled back to while the transaction is active.
        Specified by:
        beginTransaction in interface CRDTTransaction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the changeListener is already associated with a transaction
        See Also:
        CRDTTransaction.beginTransaction()

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Terminates the currently running transaction, commits the changes to the connection handler and performs all merges that have been received while the transaction was active.
        Specified by:
        commitTransaction in interface CRDTTransaction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the changeListener is not associated with a transaction.
        java.lang.SecurityException
        See Also:
        CRDTTransaction.commitTransaction()

      • getTransactionStatus

        public CRDTTransaction.TransactionStatus getTransactionStatus()
        Returns the status of the transaction associated with the changeListener.
        Specified by:
        getTransactionStatus in interface CRDTTransaction
        Returns:
        The transaction status. If no transaction is associated with the changeListener, this method returns the TransactionStatus.STATUS_NO_TRANSACTION value.
        See Also:
        CRDTTransaction.getTransactionStatus()

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Rolls back all changes that have been made within the current transaction. Make sure to get new references to your CRDT instances as those get overwritten.
        Specified by:
        rollbackTransaction in interface CRDTTransaction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the changeListener is not associated with a transaction.
        See Also:
        CRDTTransaction.rollbackTransaction()

      • setRollbackOnly

        public void setRollbackOnly()
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Modifies the transaction associated with the changeListener such that the only possible outcome of the transaction is to roll back the transaction.
        Specified by:
        setRollbackOnly in interface CRDTTransaction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the changeListener is not associated with a transaction.
        See Also:
        CRDTTransaction.setRollbackOnly()
